(47) 227 th January, 1947GABINETREPORT OF THE ROYAL COMMISSION ON EQUAL PAYNote by the Prime minister as my colleagues may be aware, a Working Party of officials have examined and reported on the Report of the Royal Commission on Equal Pay. The issues involved are complicated and important. I h^ve therefore appointed a ministerial committee, which includes representatives of all the Departments most closely concerned, to examine the matter and to report to the Cabinet. The Committeewill be constituted as follows :- Lord Privy Seal (Chairman).Chancellor of the Exchequer.Minister of Defence.Home Secretary.Secretary of State for Scotland.Minister of Labour and National Service.Minister of Education.Minister of Health.Postmaster-General.The Secretaries of the Committee will be Mr. D. H. F. Rickett, Cabinet Office,and Mrs." Johnstone, Treasury.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W. 1,7 th January, 1947.
